results.title: The Devoted Friend
results.brief_description: This open ended Oscar Wilde tale challenges us to consider whether a bully is aware that they are a bully. It questions whether you can expect a bully to reform by asking them to reflect on their actions. The story shifts focus from the question “what is a bully?” to “what is a true friend?”.

results.title: Ignatius Quince: the cautionary tale of a Child Genius
results.brief_description: Every year the school held a science fair. Ignatius Quince, being the child genius he was, had won it for the last 5 years. This year was to be no exception. Ignatius Quince was going to build the most stupendous experiment. However plans don’t always run smoothly and Ignatius Quince gets a hand from a most unexpected person, Mable Syrup.

results.title: The Gourmet's Dilemma
results.creator_credit: Robert V Jenkins, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
A light hearted yet serious educational production highlighting to new migrants the strict quarantine precautions necessary against Foot and Mouth disease and other animal diseases being introduced into Australia. The film was originally presented with the options of Greek or Italian narration, we follow Nino and his family’s passage to Australia.
Source: NFSA Film Australia Collection

results.title: Rippled
results.creator_credit: Darcy Prendergast, All India Radio and Oh Yeah Wow Pty Ltd
results.brief_description:
‘Rippled’ features a range of animation techniques - including light painting - to evoke a dystopian nighttime urban landscape of eerie beauty being explored by a creature of ambiguous identity.
Animators: Josh Thomas, Michael Greaney, Josh OKeefe, Donna Yeatman, Darcy Prendergast, Seamus Spilsbury, Andrew Onorato
Music: Martin Kennedy (All India Radio)

results.title: In the air is Christopher Gray
results.brief_description:
A series of unfortunate events leads to disaster when young Christopher Gray tries to impress the girl of his dreams.
Written, directed and animated by Felix Massie.
Cast: Andy London, Peter Ahern, Justin Cassano, Carolyn London, Ian Miller, Erica Perez
Soundtrack: Joe Paine
Sound design and mix: Marty O’Brien

results.title: Subconscious Password
results.creator_credit: Chris Landreth, Mark Smith, Marcy Page, Seneca College Animation Arts Centre, Copperheart Entertainment and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Most of us have had at least one of those excruciating social encounters where you can’t remember someone’s name. Just what is your subconscious up to while you frantically try to recall it?
Cast includes: Don McKellar, Ron Pardo, Patrice Goodman, Ray Landry, Tony Daniels, Athena Karkanis, Nanci Pach, Kedar, Denise Oliver, Dwayne Hill, Chris Landreth and John R. Dilworth.
Music: Daniel Janke
Animation direction and layout: Sean Craig

results.title: I am Tom Moody
results.brief_description:
As the performer steps up to the microphone, will the desire to make music be defeated by fears of failure and feelings of inadequacy? The awful solitude of the spotlight forces Tom to confront his inner critic.
Written, directed and animated by Ainslie Henderson.
Voices: Mackenzie Crook, Jude Crook, Rick Webster
Music: Peter Deane
Compositing: Will Anderson
Sound design: Ainslie Henderson, Joe Acheson

results.title: Holy She*p
results.creator_credit: Magnus Kravik, Katerina Pantela and Arts University Bournemouth
results.brief_description:
Pursued by a nun with a shearing blade, a sheep tries frantically to escape. Does the cruise ship visiting his island hold a hope of sybaritic freedom? Perhaps, but not in quite the way our protagonist dreams.
Story and animation: Parina Mehta, Katerina Pantela, Magnus Kravik
Layout, background and design: Heather Vogel, Katerina Pantela
Assistant animators: Mengly Li, Dominic Elsey
Editors: Carl Reader, Thorbjorn Munter
Music and sound design: Daniel Weismayr

results.title: Pifuskin
results.brief_description: Sometimes a man just has to scratch. This short animation explores notions of iritation of skin, of perception of self, of blood and bodily function.

results.title: Burger Burger
results.creator_credit: Gavin Jun Jie Tan and Huang Shicong
results.brief_description: The story of a marooned explorer who meets some local wildlife, with a scary - but eventually serendipitous - outcome. This colourful, fast-paced short animation won Best Animation at the Singapore Short Film Awards 2011.
